website_summaries.verdict: This model boasts an ergonomic design and multimedia controls with illuminated keys in various colors for different keyboard sections.
pros: Backlighting illuminates the keys on this illuminated keyboard in 3 colors for easy visibility and location of differing key sets
Ergonomically designed to maintain a comfortable typing position, and membrane key switches provide accurate and quiet typing for efficient work sessions
The brightness of the illumination is easily adjustable based on user preference
cons: Some users report that the keys tend to stick initially until they are broken in

customer_reviews.title: If you want people to think your drunk without actually drinking this is the keyboard for you.
customer_reviews.text: I look like a drunk toddler online! Every other word is missing letters. I have to stop and edit EVERY SENTENCE! Same sentences unedited: I lok lie a drnk oddle oline! Evey other word is missinglettes. I have o sop and edi EVERY SENENCE! Space bar sticks, enter button sticks. It's ridiculous. It also came cracked! I have to mash the keys super hard, then everyone in the house things I am rage chatting! My family and friends are concerned! They keep telling me to go to an AA meeting! The only nice thing is the light up colors are cool.
customer_reviews.author: Jmattice

customer_reviews.title: Horrible sensitivity, or lack thereof.
customer_reviews.text: Do not but this unless you really want to get aggravated and end up smashing the keyboard. The space bar does not respond, some of the other keys do not as well unless you literally hit them with such force the rest of the house will think you are typing an extremely angry email. Stay far away from this one. I just ended the one I bought and plugged in my old keyboard and couldn't be happier to get rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: two keyboards ended up giving up the ghost.
customer_reviews.text: what I hoped would be the amswer to my dreams, a backlit ergonomic keyboard, has been a non-stop problem. I returned to first keyboard when it arbitrarily stopped working in feb2017. It is now April and the replacement keyboard has stopped working too. I purchased the squaretrade warranty but I hope they give me the option of a refund. Because these keyboards are crap. UPDATE: so Squaretrade says my keyboard is still under the manufacturers warranty so I must contact Adesso, and turns out I have to pay to send the keyboard to them for either a "replacement or credit". Save yourself the headache and stay away from the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Zoo

customer_reviews.title: Space bar doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this keyboard. Looks great, colors change easy and keys are well lit and easy to read but it just doesn't work. I can't get the right space bar to work more than half the time. I have tried to use it for a few days and it is just getting worse. Now the back space bar has stopped working. This is really bad because you can't fix all the mistakes you make from the space bar not working. I can't find another back lit Ergonomic keyboard on the web so I really wanted this to work, but it flat out does NOT.
customer_reviews.author: Darell Delane Canup

customer_reviews.title: Keypresses are unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard because it was the most cost effective split/ergo keyboard out there, plus its backlit, so bonus! Unfortunately the quality of the main functionality (aka pressing keys and having the computer register them) is very poor. Unless you are an extremely light user, this keyboard should be avoided. IMPORTANT: Not return eligible via Amazon return policy, unlike other keyboards marketed and sold on the everything store, so you're gambling to save a little money/get the back-lit functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't always register your key strike.
customer_reviews.text: You may be able to type at 70 Words per minute, without looking at the screen, but when you go to check your spelling, it will take you 3 times longer than it took to write, due to all the missed key strokes. I do my finances, and have to redo them constantly, or take 2 times as long doing them, just to verify that EVERY key I hit, registers. This keyboard is junk. Looks cool, and ergonomically designed, but total junk.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Lichtig

customer_reviews.title: Utter rubbish and non-returnable
customer_reviews.text: It is incredibly loud. It doesn't record fast keystrokes. If you have something with repeated numbers or Double letters it won't pick up the second one. If I could return it and get my money back I would but apparently I can't. If I can give this junk clutter negative stars I would. Basically if you know how to type avoid this keyboard. if you're someone who has to look at the keyboard and press the keys one at a time instead of typing by feel this might be the keyboard for you. Disappointed beyond belief for the amount of money this cost.
customer_reviews.author: Nth

customer_reviews.title: Several keys didn't work. Requested a refund. No luck.
customer_reviews.text: Would have to slap certain keys with enough force to nearly make the key break for a keystroke to register. Sent in a request for refund, seller sent back a reply, "we'll follow up on Monday." They never followed up. I didn't follow up on them not following up, now outside of refund period... 1/10 would not try again.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Hudson

customer_reviews.title: OK, misses key strokes
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for about a year now and I have to agree with some of the previous comments, it simply misses key strokes, especially on the space bar. I also wish the space bar wasn't split as it is, sometimes my thumbs hit the empty space. As for the back lights, they are so-so. There's probably just a few lights under the keys and some of the keys aren't fully lit, so it makes hunting for a non used key frustrating. While this seems to be the only ergo keyboard with back lights, it's not worth it. I'm going back to my old keyboard, less missed keys.
customer_reviews.author: rodney c. wright

customer_reviews.title: Use tape
customer_reviews.text: lol, okay, I figured out how to make the ergonomic Illuminated Keyboard really ergonomic! Use tape! Don't know if you can see the clear plastic tape I used to keep it from moving. I put a towel underneath the keyboard and then taped it down to secure it. It's crap, yes, but the keyboard is way TOO FLAT unless maybe you are standing at a desk. And the space bar! Oh man, is that irritating! Why didn't they just make it all the way across??? Even having a small split would be fine. But this split is way too big for my thumbs to get used to!
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Andoff

customer_reviews.title: and it's really horrible. The action is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard a few months now...and it's really horrible. The action is terrible. You have to sometimes "hammer" the keys to get them to respond. It's very awkward. Would rather pay $150.00 for one that works properly. It's NO comparison to the Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard. The ONLY thing it has going for it...and the only reason I gave it 2 Stars...is because the keys do light up! I will put a light over my keyboard for night time typing. Not worth it at even half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel N.

customer_reviews.title: Letters don't rub off
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy for me. I had an issue with the letters rubbing off my keyboard. I've tried labels but they eventually rub off too. I ended up buying new keyboard after new keyboard. That gets pricey – especially when you want an ergonomic model. This keyboard is the solution. The letters won't rub off. My only complaint is that it is loud. I attend school online, and I have to mute my mic every time I want to type because everyone says my keyboard is so annoyingly. I wish they made this in a quieter model. Even so, I would buy it again. It's cool that you can change the colors too.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria G.

customer_reviews.title: Loud keys,no leg risers, short space bar, great lite up keys
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I am returning this item I was ready to be 100% excited about. The best is that the keys are great all lit up. The bad is that the sounds on the keys is very clickity clack, the spacebar does not go all the way across the bottom and there are no raise legs, I'd even be willing to buy a keyboard riser if the other 2 items listed were such a significant issue.
customer_reviews.author: AllisonB-LA

customer_reviews.title: Basic duty keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is the only keyboard i could find that had both backlit keys and the ergo shape, so difficult to compare. The colors are nice, although i prefer blue and every time the PC is cycled, the color has to be reset. I'd be fine if it was just an off white or something. As others have mentioned, some keys stick so it is not really a professional grade keyboard. The shift doesn't work unless you hit the outer half of it, so pretty annoying when touch typing. But i knew that in advance and don't need, need it, and it does a fair job with regular duty.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W.

customer_reviews.title: Loud and broken
customer_reviews.text: When I received this keyboard the backspace key was at a very wonky angle. I popped it back into place and everything seemed fine. I proceeded to plug it in and test it out. I have to put a solid amount of pressure on all the keys, but the backspace only works randomly and I have to nearly hit it to get it to work. Overall the keyboard is really really loud in an office setting. I would never buy this again. Sure, it lights up fine, but the quality is very poor.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleybearrows

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard in particular because it was the only split-key keyboard I could find with backlit keys. The keys do require a bit of force to make sure it registers that you've typed a letter, though it does get easier with practice. The 'Y' key tends to get stuck if you tap it at the wrong angle, leaving yyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyou with this. Those are my only real complaints. Yeah, it's kind of large, especially if you have a sliding keyboard tray; but it's not too big. Otherwise, it's actually a pretty decent keyboard for the price. All of the multimedia keys seem to work just fine with Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: The_Carr

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Had Expected
customer_reviews.text: Cheap piece of plastic. Enter key sticks down and doesn’t make the click sound as the other keys. There aren’t any height adjustments available for this keyboard. The keyboard is bulky and looks like a toy. I had to snap my keyboard together the first day I got it out of the box. I don’t believe I should be able to see light bleeding through the sides as they were. It was very noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Slightly Off Center
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it lights up, but there was something slightly off-center about it and it was hard to get my hands back on the home keys. I had to watch my hands in order to type--not good. After a week of trying to get used to it, I went back to my Microsoft ergonomic keyboard despite its inability to cheer me with lights. Difference in typing speed between the Adesso Tru-Form and My Microsoft keyboard was about 30 WPM.
customer_reviews.author: George (Georgiana)

customer_reviews.title: terrible
customer_reviews.text: absolute junk. Not bright, doesnt click well, typing is odd on this, the keys are over sized... sad its the only option. Wife used it for a month and went back to the MS ergo keyboard with no lights. Is a shame.
customer_reviews.author: JAHMLH

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Barely functional. Colors are nice, and color level can be set, but the keys are NOT silent and the keyboard is very awkward, especially since there is no option to tilt it. I find it very difficult to hit the shift key and any other key with the same hand, and find myself really having to retype stuff a lot because the keys don't register unless pressed square on.
customer_reviews.author: Mario V Nigrovic

customer_reviews.title: Worst ergonomic keyboard for gaming or programming
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted an ergonomic, illuminated keyboard. And while this is exactly that, it SUCKS for programming, because it can NOT, NOT, NOT keep up with how fast I type. It misses keystrokes constantly. If you are getting this for gaming, forget about it. You will die 10 seconds into your game, because the it just does not have the reaction necessary. This keyboard may be fine for your average user, but NOT for tech professionals.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G.

customer_reviews.title: addictive keyboard !
customer_reviews.text: Spoiler alert! You are NOT buying three keyboards but one that can be any of the colors listed. I really like this keyboard. I am typing this in a darkened room and I can clearly see the keys (Yes I look at the keys as I type at times, sue me). I dont think I can ever go back to a non illuminated keyboard again. I miss my microsoft ergonomic keyboard. This tries to be similar and it comes close but not the same. I had issues with it at first as you sometimes really have to hit the keys but now that I am "used to it" I like it fine.
customer_reviews.author: JKS

customer_reviews.title: ... this keyboard a few months now and am not happy with it at all
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this keyboard a few months now and am not happy with it at all. It is comfortable and well lit, but the keystroke misses and constantly having to backspace is frustrating. I also game a lot. The failure of the keys at critical moments is infuriating. I will be buying a new keyboard shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Lyons

customer_reviews.title: I really hate the split in the space bar
customer_reviews.text: My fault for not thinking about that when I ordered it, but it's unusable for me. There's no space bar where I'm used to hitting the bar with my thumb. There's a logo. Ugh. I'm returning this. I'll never get used to it. If you don't mind that, you'll probably like this keyboard. Everything else about it is acceptable, and the illumination is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Master of Cats

customer_reviews.title: Nice.  Would like more colors
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these keyboards I have purchased. It's good, but also it seems to be the only lighted ergonomic keyboard. I would like to have more colors (red, blue, green) and a bit more brightness.
customer_reviews.author: James Wj Rose

customer_reviews.title: Technically meets the requirements. But not that good compared to any cheap keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Overall is is an OK keyboard. The backlighting for the keys is uniform but not very bright. It cannot be controlled from the PC as far as I can tell. You can choose 1 of 3 colors and vary the brightness. But that is for the entire keyboard. There is no control for sections or individual keys. The key travel is quiet but somewhat long which causes me to miss type some words. Still adapting to the split spacebar. Function keys are not programmable that I can find. I will continue to use it for now. But I will replace it when I find another backlit ergonomic keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AVOID!!! It's costs $10 to find out this is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Don't be duped like I was, believe all the other 1-star reviews. If you're used to good keyboards you aren't going to like this one. The feel of the keys isn't very good at all, about what you get on a $10 keyboard. But if you want back lit and don't care what the keys feel like you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: WARNING. It is not quiet and returns are not easy.
customer_reviews.text: I actually ordered this because the product description said it provided for a quieter typing experience which I need because I type while on a conference call and if the keyboard is clanking, it is distracting. Warning, this "quieter" claim is totally untrue! I never even removed the keyboard from the box. I opened it, hit a few keys, and found it to be much louder than the Microsoft keyboard I currently use. It went back already (and if you order from THIS seller, here's your second warning: they won't pay for the shipping return). This was an all-around unhappy purchasing experience.
customer_reviews.author: R. S. Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Keys do not always work, some keys stick, and lighting only partially lights keys.
customer_reviews.text: I really hoped that this keyboard would work because I wanted a lighted ergo keyboard. Unfortunately, this keyboard was bad. The characters on the keys were not completely lit, some keys stuck, and some keys did not produce characters reliably. The bottom line is that a keyboard must display a character when pressed. This keyboard could not reliably do that.
customer_reviews.author: Rooster

customer_reviews.title: Boooooooo!
customer_reviews.text: I just started using this keyboard last night and I already hate it. I don't know if I type too fast for the keys to keep up or what, but it is very persnickety and if you don't press the keys just right it will not type the letter or do the action, etc. I bought this for work purposes, not gaming, but it's a keyboard so it just work like my old one did. The only redeeming quality are the pretty colors. I will be ordering a replacement today. #sadface
customer_reviews.author: Antisocial Butterfly

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS KEYBOARD!  YOU WILL ALMOST CERTAINLY REGRET IT.
customer_reviews.text: I've had good luck with other models of Adesso keyboards so I chose to ignore the reviews and give it a try. What a mistake. Sure, it looks nice and the keys are laid out well. But the contacts are noisy and unreliable. Like many others I keep skipping letters. The whole point of an ergonomic keyboard is for a touch typist to type quickly. Well abandon all hope ye who enters here. I spent more time correcting unforced mistakes than typing. What a shame. Such great potential. TIme to store this one away with mothballs.
customer_reviews.author: Chaim Samuel

customer_reviews.title: It's not really ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have the flip-down feet on the back, so you can't prop it up to get the proper ergo position for the actual board, there is a delay in the keys, which makes it horrible for gaming. It is bright at the top, but it's lit so not all of the keys are completely lit up, it's weird. If I were to do it gain, I'd take a hard pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: KRunsonlattes

customer_reviews.title: Keys stick or don't type the letters.
customer_reviews.text: Keys sticky and have to hit a key several times to get the letters to come up. I use the Adesso Ergonomic keyboard usually, but wanted to try this one with illuminated keys. Yes, the letters are clearer on the keyboard. The tilt of the keyboard and feel of how the hands and fingers rest on the keyboard is very different from the basic. I was willing to give it a few days to see if I could adjust, but the keys not typing the letters was a major problem. I had no trouble at all returning it and re-ordered the regular ergo keyboard instead.
customer_reviews.author: IndyKat

customer_reviews.title: This is almost the perfect keyboard for me
customer_reviews.text: 6/2 Update: Amazon sent me a replacement and it is working like a champ. Other than items below this is a great keyboard This is almost the perfect keyboard. The ergonomics feel great, looks good but there are 2 minor issues I have found. 1. Minor - Placement of the F keys and PrtScn/ScrLock/Break keys make them easily pushed when hitting a number key or Ins/Home/PU keys 2. Minor - this is a loud keyboard, clickity clack is what you get
customer_reviews.author: Frank Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Good product. I got what was described.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I got what was described. Some keys faded after about 6 months of use. I use it for work everyday so it was used a lot. After using a mechanical keyboard this comes second. But great for the price. Connection is lost sometimes and I had to unplug and re-plug every now and then but nothing that was too nerve racking.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Burkeen

customer_reviews.title: Keys are not necessarily easy to push down
customer_reviews.text: The space key on the left side of this keyboard no longer works and no I didn't spill anything nor is there any material down in the keys......do yourself a favor and get a nice tactile type keyboard that responds quicker wish I could return this.
customer_reviews.author: Dean H.

customer_reviews.title: Returned this Item
customer_reviews.text: 1). The backlit quality of illumination was not evenly distributed and having only 3-colors, one of them should have been white. 2). The "space-bar" was split into 2 (one on the left, one in the right and nothing in the middle or center. 3). There was no legs under the keyboard to at least raise it for better typing.
customer_reviews.author: Brother William

customer_reviews.title: Loud and Proud
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit loud for work, but what do I care? Sara talks to herself all day, so this helps drown her out. It does feel kind of cheap, but for what I paid for it, that's expected. I haven't had any issues with keys sticking like some of the other reviews, but time will tell. I would have preferred the colors fade into each other instead of just choosing between the three, but no biggie.
customer_reviews.author: Christy G

customer_reviews.title: w
customer_reviews.text: I've used an ergonomic keyboard for decades. The husband had a light up keyboard, so I thought I'd this one a try. The keyboard is off, the keys aren't exactly where they should be. Also, you have to type really hard to get some of the keys to work. I do not like this keyboard at all. I'm going back to my old trusted version.
customer_reviews.author: ELB

customer_reviews.title: A mushy unergonomic lightshow
customer_reviews.text: "Ergonomic" look, evidently they never used a ergonomic keyboard previously in their lives because it's just a normal keyboard split at a slightly funny angle with a tiny bend to the board. It has no wrist support, no physical adjustability, and they split the space bar in half exactly where the thumb wants to rest. Don't get this if you have large hands. The lights are pretty, the key placement is terrible, its feel is mushy, it sounds like a typewriter. Get a Microsoft Natural Ergonomic 4000 if you actually want to protect your wrists.
customer_reviews.author: CTL

customer_reviews.title: Nice try - but there are betters
customer_reviews.text: Close, but no cigar. The Microsoft keyboard is profoundly better due to the "hump" in the middle. They didn't pay ergonomic scientists millions to develop that keyboard for nothing. This is a relatively cheap knockoff. While better than a standard horizontal keyboard - you're probably better off sticking with Microsoft. Buy them while you still can. I may stock up on a few just in case they "go away." I just wish the Microsoft version was available backlit.
customer_reviews.author: mrk030

customer_reviews.title: Best backlit split keyboard currently on the market
customer_reviews.text: I like that the letters are large and easy to see. I was surprised and pleased the buttons above the arrow keys are spelled out and not abbreviated as shown on the photos. I deducted 1 star because the keyboard defaults back to Green when the computer is turned off/rebooted, I like the Blue setting. Buttons are a little mushy, but after a few weeks, I've gotten use to it. Update: After several months of use, the keys are less stiff and seem to function as well as the MS Natural Keyboard it replaced. I still haven't found a work around for the keyboard defaulting to Green after every reboot, other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: GISGUY34

customer_reviews.title: A good keyboard for people who don't know how to type, but with a couple of minor flaws
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard lights up as expected, though I wish there was a purple color in the lighting. The spacebar on the keyboard is separated into two different pieces and takes some getting used to if you are used to having a whole spacebar to click on as you type. The mute function button has the strange effect of starting/opening the e-mail client program whenever it is pressed. While this doesn't affect the button's functionality, it is annoying and shouldn't happen. Otherwise, it's a good keyboard if you don't know how to type, need to look at the keyboard, and don't have a light source nearby to see all the keys. It definitely fulfilled a need and is worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Key Clicks are Flakey and Can Only Set Keyboard for One Color
customer_reviews.text: I've used ergonomic keyboards for years. I decided to purchase this keyboard because the keys are backlit. I discovered that I could only set red, blue or green. Also, the keyboard only supports one zone, unlike the photo. I can live with a single color but having to tap each key hard (especially the space keys) is a showstopper.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great illumination -- clicks little bit to loud.  It's life span only 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: Very good keyboard -- illumination is bright with ability to switch color depending of your preferences. What I don't like it's very loud noise the keys making when typing. Sensitivity of the keys is low -- to get character typed it's necessary to fully press the key, so it'll touch the "bottom". I am OK with this, but some people may not like it. Overall this is a great product for the price. --- Update after 3 year --- reducing rating to 3 stars After 3 years of regular use it broke -- several keys became unavailable -- pressing didn't produce any output, and some were printing junk characters. So I had to garbage this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: pixa00

customer_reviews.title: keyboard ok... vender not so much
customer_reviews.text: the keyboard is okay, but the lack of feet or anyway to adjust it killed it for me. i tried to return it and ended up in return hell. so rather than return it i will just throw it away since after all my troubles there is a 20% restock charge? this is not a custom item that is over the top!
customer_reviews.author: Roberta

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard is too cheap. My fingers started to hurt ...
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is too cheap. My fingers started to hurt after a few hours. I normally use a MS Keyboard 4000. I was really hoping this would work because I've been looking for a backlit ergonomic keyboard for a long long time. But this one just didn't cut it. The actual keyboard quality wasn't up to snuff due to the pressure needed to press each key. My typing sessions can last hours at a time, so this just wasn't a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Rogue428

customer_reviews.title: An OK keyboard, extra features work spottily
customer_reviews.text: When I received the keyboard the backlight for the keys was not working. They eventually did come on, then would go out again for days at a time, additionally when they are out the indicator lights for the num lock and caps lock do not work. I thought about keeping it even with those issues, but the key layout is just enough off from the Microsoft Natural that I am used to, that it was increasing typos. I am returning it and will get another MS Natural.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Updike

customer_reviews.title: Believe the 1 star reviews! Stay away from this keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I've already repackaged and set up the return with amazon, all within 15 minutes of receiving the keyboard from UPS. Believe the 1 star reviews, ignore the 5 star ones. Received today. First impression: Wow this thing is so light... I tried to type (I touch type) and key presses were not registered / missed very often. The keys are also abnormally large, so I easily accidentally pressed nearby keys resulting in even more typos. It's just sad that in 2016, you can't get a decent backlit ergonomic keyboard. Back to my MS X8 keyboard I guess.
customer_reviews.author: hakbox android

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I used this keyboard for a total of 30 minutes. I could not get used to how close the keys were. I had to switch back to my old keyboard so I could work efficiently. I've used ergonomic split keyboards for 20+ years and this one is just uncomfortable. The keys are not brightly lit. It was shipped very quickly to me and packaged very well.
customer_reviews.author: glmhorselover

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: Get what you pay for. It's cheap. LOUD clicks as you type. BRIGHT backlighting. HUGE BLOCK LETTERS. You will not need your glasses to see these! If you don't need it for anything (ie gaming, pro stuff) in particular, then its fine. Did I mention it was loud? I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Reader #1002

customer_reviews.title: Love the lighted keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I love the back lighting and the feel of the keys. The back lighting allows me to leave the overhead lights down low and work in near darkness. I can make the light bright or dim with four levels. The only thing I didn't like originally was the fact that there is no war to adjust the height of the keys as the keyboard lies flat on the desktop. other than that complaint it is a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: John an Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice large easy to read keys
customer_reviews.text: Like the ergonomic design, Had one years ago but changed computers and it did not work with the new tower. This one plugged in and work fine. Like the palm rest on the front and the split and angled key pad is a lot easier on my old wrists.Iluminated keys helps to, do not always have to have a light on to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Constance A Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes its not perfect but you will not find an ergonomic keyboard that lights up. That being said I love having my main light off and still able to see the keyboard we now have 3 of them and love them. I dont do gaming but I imagine it would be the same.
customer_reviews.author: superdad

customer_reviews.title: Loud typing
customer_reviews.text: I like that its an illuminated ergo split keyboard but it is so annoyingly loud to type on. Also some of the keys stick and don't work well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The lighting is great. Letters are easy to see
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This is the only lit ergonomic keyboard on the market as far as I know. The lighting is great. Letters are easy to see, beautiful and you can change the color of the lighting between green, blue and red. Cons: The key response is horrible. If you are a fast typer or if you try to play any (even very simple) computer games, key strokes will simply be dropped. This makes the keyboard feel unresponsive. In reality, it works just fine as long as you type SLOOOW.
customer_reviews.author: Angelique

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: This looks great and the markings will not scrape off the keys. But the action of some of the keys is not very smooth. Most affected is the left space bar. I do not touch type so I can deal with this, but someone who does would not like the feel of this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: E. Zelda Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Basic ergonomic keyboard but has issues.
customer_reviews.text: When setting the keyboard color / brightness. Every few hours they keyboard resets back to the original green color and the indicators for caps lock, num lock, and scroll lock go blank even though those settings are active. The palm rest of the keyboard is basic plastic and I find if I rest my hands on the actual keyboard, my hands will slip off they keyboard. therefore you need to allway hover your hands over the keyboard while typing.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: The Adesso Tru-Form 150 is a good keyboard for what it is
customer_reviews.text: The Adesso Tru-Form 150 is a good keyboard for what it is. If you are looking for an ergonomic keyboard with which you can crank out page after page of text for hours on end, you may want to look elsewhere. If you are looking for an ergonomic keyboard that is back-lit so you can hammer out the occasional late night term paper, feed your social media addiction through the wee hours of the night, or quietly pull a late night gaming session as a gamer on a budget, then this keyboard is more than adequate for the task.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Shallenberger

customer_reviews.title: Good for very low budget use.
customer_reviews.text: The lights don't span the entire length/face of the keys. There're dead spots on each key resulting in partially lit letters.
customer_reviews.author: John Hessong

customer_reviews.title: I ignored the reviews - I shouldn’t have
customer_reviews.text: Keys aren’t very responsive - I want it enough to get it. But the B key sticks and won’t stop. Someone please make a good split backlit keyboard someday? We want it! And a few months later, trying to adapt to the B key and file it down - and now the Enter key sticks. I want a backlit ergo split enough to keep trying and hoping it'd work in - it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: L. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Two Reasons to Buy This Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: 1. Its ergonomic .... 2. Its backlit.... now the reason why you should pass on it ... YOU CANNOT SPEED TYPE ON IT! The keys are clunky! Why are keyboard manufacturers pushing terrible keyboards on us? Oh yes, to get a quick buck.
customer_reviews.author: Loving Life More

customer_reviews.title: The painted keys wore off!  Otherwide it was perfect!
customer_reviews.text: But now I'm shopping for a new ergonomic keyboard that's back-lit and DOESN'T HAVE PAINTED ON KEY CHARACTERS! Other than that...it has been perfect! to bad they chinced-out by painting the keys on. =(
customer_reviews.author: 1farstar

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I got a lemon or what. Have been using ergo keyboards for years. This one here, wow. About 10% of the time, the key you press wouldn't "type out", and you'd have to backspace and retry it. The backspace key had a delay so correcting an aggravation was aggravating in and of itself. You had to pound the keys harder than any board I've ever had to ensure the letter would type out. Used it for two days and threw it away. Worst keyboard ever.
customer_reviews.author: C. Beard

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!  KEYS DO NOT STROKE MOST OF THE TIME
customer_reviews.text: BAD PURCHASE!! Keys do not register half of the strokes made, always having to go back and correct words. Key strokes are very loud. Only positive thing about the board it that it has back light to the keys. I would not even give it 1 star, but I am forced to. Would be happy if i could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: HappyAmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Good lighted keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great for a lighted keyboard. I'm a speed typer though and it doesn't always keep up, it frequently misses letters. If I key slower it catches everything so i have to mentally remind myself to slow down and proof everything before hitting send. As a gaming keyboard i think it would be great but for office use it lacks a bit.
customer_reviews.author: DigitalGeek

customer_reviews.title: Lighted
customer_reviews.text: It is so nice to not have my office light on during the day. I am mainly a touch typist, but have never taken the time to really learn my numbers or infrequently used punctuations/symbols (still generally need them at some point in the day though).
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this. I have waited for many years for ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this. I have waited for many years for a lightup natural keyboard so I bought this as soon as I saw it. Sadly the key response is abysmal. I tried tweaking it in the OS but it is a physical problem. If you only use your keyboard for gaming and don't type much it might meet you needs but if you use it for coding the frustration of debugging when the keyboard decides you didn't need that character is beyond frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Mekareami

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom who likes the MS Natural keyboards, but kept wearing out her keys somehow. I like that it has larger letters which are easier to for seniors to see, but it has a funny design which is hard to get squared on your desk properly. The back-lighting works ok, but I wish the colors could be adjusted to something other than just Red, Green, or Blue, and that the brightness could be changed. The keys have a cheap feel and are rather noisy. My mom seems to like it, but I wouldn't really recommend it for anyone that isn't looking specifically for a "ergonomic" keyboard. There are better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic features
customer_reviews.text: I loved the ergonomic features that virtually eliminated any hand and wrist fatigue. The lighted feature was also fun and great in lower light conditions. The key response is as good as any other keyboard I have used. I definitely would recommend it. I ordered a second keyboard, I liked it so well. I hope it performs as well as my first one.
customer_reviews.author: Jon C.

customer_reviews.title: It is great to use & fun with the different colors
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is really easy to use - light to the touch so there is no strain on my hands or fingers + being able to use different colors makes it fun to use :) It was advertised to be good for those who work at night and this fits my description perfectly - no more strain on my eyes :)
customer_reviews.author: Denya S. Jur

customer_reviews.title: It is great to have a back lit key board and the ...
customer_reviews.text: It is great to have a back lit key board and the ergonomic key layout is great for those with carpel tunnel problems or for anyone who likes to keep their hands in a neutral position while typing. I am not, however, crazy about the tactile feel of the key board. This is a highly subjective area and different for anyone who uses keyboards regularly. I am going to give it a good try before making a final decision to keep or move on to another key board
customer_reviews.author: JimW

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Colors awesome, however at least 3 sets of keys are sticking together, f and 5 , worst one is left ctrl key, another is right shift key, been in IT for 20 yrs, worst functioning keyboard purchased ever, nothing on amazon but i would not recommend this product to anyone! Tried to use again today and it slowed down my work. Had to unplug and remove. The left ctrl key was a huge issue, i spent more time pulling it unstuck than typing.
customer_reviews.author: Clint King

customer_reviews.title: Threw in the trash after less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is absolute junk. The illumination was nice but that's the only good thing I can say about it. It's very loud and after less than two months of use, you practically had to use a hammer to get a keystroke out of it. Not just one key, but all keys were like this. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: JCMFD

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a back-lit ergonomic keyboard for a long time so I ordered this the instant I saw it. The Good: Three colors of back-lighting are easy to change. The keyboard is not expensive. The Bad: The keys were an odd size and I found it hard to get comfortable typing. It was also very loud. The key layout is not particularly ergonomic. Its like a straight keyboard was split in half and the two halves rotated a few degrees. The Ugly: The left shift key failed within a day and I had to return it. On this alone, I might have re-ordered but I didn't like the keyboard itself.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: But otherwise it works great. I have a ergonomic keyboard that is bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: If it wasn't so noise when I typed, I would give it 5 stars. But otherwise it works great. I have a ergonomic keyboard that is bluetooth, but the keys don't light up. I like that the keys are lit and you can change the color so I can type without having an overhead light on. Also like that it is wired and not bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: kc5thy

customer_reviews.title: Lights are great, keyboard sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Nice set up but the keys stick very bad. Love the lights but the keyboard needs work. I'm going to let my son work on it because it's a nice set up but I'm going back to my Microsoft ergo board. I'm a writer and my word count went from fifty words a minute to thirty because i had to keep hitting keys twice or backspace. When they fix these problems I'll try again. It did arrive fast but I won't buy it again unless they work on the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: TA Watson

customer_reviews.title: Two L keys!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these in Feb. One was in storage until today....WTF? It has two L keys (right next to each other). The right most L is actually the ; key. Dang, too late for a return or repair. Sold by Amazon. Being a backlit keyboard I'm not sure how easy it will be to find a replacement key. I guess that's what touch typing is for. Next time I'll have to inspect before putting an item into storage. Other than the two L keys the keyboards are pretty sweet.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: I love the light up keys
customer_reviews.text: I love the light up keys! It's great for working early in the day or late in the evening when you don't want to have bright lights on in the room. Unfortunately, a couple of the keys started sticking within the first month. Today, after less than 2 months of use, one of the keys became loose every single time I struck it. So as you can imagine, I had to stop using it and buy a different keyboard. I really miss the light-up keys!
customer_reviews.author: Dewey Wagner

customer_reviews.title: The Adesso Tru-Form 3-color keyboard is great in theory
customer_reviews.text: The Adesso Tru-Form 3-color keyboard is great in theory, the colored, illuminated keyboard is really gentle on the eyes but where it falls short is typing accuracy. The keys tend to stick or not activate properly leading to endless typos and misspelled words. While I'm comfortable visually and physically for gaming, work etc.. the difficulty in getting the keys to properly activate ends up being a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: MeadowJackie

customer_reviews.title: Great value, truly ergonomic, noisy keys.
customer_reviews.text: Great ergonomic keyboard, and I like the 3 different backlit keys colors, along with a way to minimize the intensity. However, the noisy keys detract from the overall functionality of the unit. The keys feel solid enough when typing, but they rattle like hell!. Remove that minor issue and this would, for the price, be a five-star keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: 5th Buck

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, you don't have to waste your money on ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this keyboard is the only offering on the market for a backlit ergonomic keyboard. Fortunately, you don't have to waste your money on it. The keys aren't reliably responsive, leading to many missed keystrokes and a decrease in typing speed. If you enjoy punishing and frustrating yourself, this is the perfect keyboard for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Meh. It works, but I’m not overly impressed.
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. May just be me... but the keys don’t have as nice of a feel as I had hoped. Lights are ok. Nice colors, but not all the characters are fully and clearly lit. Won’t return... won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: The space bar should is not comfortable for me.
customer_reviews.text: For me, the space bar should be in one piece and not separated in the middle. It isn't comfortable for me. I like the keyboard otherwise, especially the lit keys in 3 colors.
customer_reviews.author: Betty J. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is a little on the stiff side. You do have to make sure that you hit the keys hard enough for them to register. I haven't had it long, I bought it for my use at work. I sit at a desk all day and work only on the computer. That puts a strain on the wrists and hands after a while. The only complaint that I have so far is the number pad. The 0 doesn't like to register all of the time and the 7 loves to stick. Other than that I think that this keyboard will work well for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Not a typists keyboard
customer_reviews.text: There is no way to permanently set the color -- powers up in green. There is something also about the strike of the keys. You must slow down when entering double letters like in "week" or "unless". Strike them too fast together and only one letter gets through and you end up typing "wek" or "unles". This is really irksome and makes it useless for people who type a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Tomm Carr

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetically pleasing, lacking in function
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the prettiest ergonomic keyboard I could find, so I got what I asked for there. But... as several others have said, it doesn't work very well. The keys seem to respond inconsistently. No amount of muscle memory has allowed me to adjust to these finicky keys... and typing passwords is a HUGE pain! I like the pretty blue glow, I can't lie about that. And I like that the keys are nice and bold and easy to see/read. I wish they were easier to press. :(
customer_reviews.author: Tess O'Rourke

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard after a rocky start.
customer_reviews.text: After returning the first keyboard I received because two keys did not work (left shift key and the "y" key), I received the second one and it has been working flawlessly. I like the lighted keys and the three choices as to color and the brightness control. I also like the feel of the keys and the push of the key. The size and shape of the keys, including the Ctrl, Alt, and space bar keys are not an issue. I don't know why all keyboards aren't lighted! Now the only question is how long the lights will last and whether the keyboard will continue to work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: I had to return it.
customer_reviews.text: While the illuminated keyboard is very helpful, I found that it was far too flimsy: lightweight plastic, and various keys continued to stick, i.e. either they would not register at all when I hit them or they would suddenly print twice. I had to send it back. Sure wish Microsoft would come up with the same keyboard I really like and give me an illuminated option; so far, they haven't!
customer_reviews.author: Jan Roth

customer_reviews.title: Ok Product
customer_reviews.text: Durability is not the best, I have had for 3 months and the paint has been coming off of some of the keys for at least half that time. Some keys take 3 times to hit them for them to work. I like the features and such of this keyboard, but will not purchase this again. I attached some pictures to show the worn keys.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Tessen

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, product works as expected. However, it is 10 days shy of a year and the space bars are crapping out. Ignores every other space-key strike, both left and right side, even with sharp typing.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen P. Mohrhoff

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: i bought this keyboard to practice typing and it does type, but its space bar isnt very responcive and the keys are placed oddly lowering my accuracy a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Piglet LaBeef

customer_reviews.title: Bad response keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money on this keyboard. I have a microsoft ergo keyboard that I was trying to replace with a lighted version. Bought this one and it is horrible. I am a gamer and this thing doesn't respond to all my key strokes. It misses enough to make it VERY noticeable when typing in chat and just trying to play the game. I have had it too long to get a refund. Please try any other because this thing is crap. It isn't even good enough for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: It is thin and does not feel good like a real ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is really light and as the description says it has no back legs for height. It is thin and does not feel good like a real ergonomic keyboard. I bought it in hopes that it would be good since it is the only one I could find with LED but the price is the same as a good ergonomic keyboard. I switched back to my regular one in ten minutes. It also can only have one color. You do not get to choose your configuration or have it different colors at once in different sections. You choose one color and that is it.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Rizor

customer_reviews.title: Would be a great keyboard if the keys themselves were better!
customer_reviews.text: I like the layout, as it is similar to the Microsoft Ergonomic keyboard 4000 that I love so much. The backlighting is nice (the main reason why I bought it), and the keycap legends are nice and big and very readable. However, the keys themselves don't have a very good feel to them. They stick if you don't press straight down, and it "misses" letters if I type too fast. And finally, for some strange reason the space bar is split - so there is a space right where my thumb normally hits the space bar!
customer_reviews.author: D. Workman

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn't react well to my fingers
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard design is fine ergonomically and the lights are fine, but It often doesn't register my keypress so I'm missing spaces and characters. I'm a programmer and spend most of my time at the keyboard, I gave it a month and it hasn't gotten any better. If you aren't constantly typing it might be the keyboard for you, but I can't really afford to have to go back through and fix typo's
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great once you break it in
customer_reviews.text: It took a while to break this thing in, close to 2 months. At first get used to making a ton of mistakes, you have to apply an abnormal amount of pressure on each key to get it to register. After a couple of months I can touch type again but those first couple of months sucked pretty bad, writing papers for school and having to retype constantly was no fun. Id say it was mostly worth it to break it in but be warned of the drawbacks this keyboard has.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Keys too springy
customer_reviews.text: Everything arrived well packaged and in good shape. I used the keyboard for two weeks but I kept getting relating keystrokes or missed keystrokes due to how hard I had to depress keys cos there is so much travel in the keys. I gave it to a coworker and she loves it! To each their own.
customer_reviews.author: RGS2010

customer_reviews.title: Eehhhh it’s alright.
customer_reviews.text: I am trying word trying to make this keyboard work for me. I am finding that I make so many mistakes. It’s not my cup of tea I guess. The keys just don’t seem to hit right on fingers. Almost like it’s too slick or something. I type ALL day and loved my Microsoft ergonomic keyboard but the letters wore off quickly so I thought maybe a light up board would last longer. But here’s 2 weeks later and I’m searching for something else....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This isn't a bad keyboard if you want ergonomic and backlit
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a bad keyboard if you want ergonomic and backlit. Of course, if you want that your options are pretty limited.... The only issue with this is that sometimes the keys either stick or don't process quick enough and misspellings occur. (I know I was thinking it could just be operator error, but when I type on other keyboards I don't have the same errors.)
customer_reviews.author: E. M. Zobrist

product_meta.title: Adesso Tru-Form 150 3-Color Illuminated Ergonomic Keyboard AKB-150EB
product_meta.description:
The Adesso Tru-Form 150 – 3-Color Illuminated Ergonomic keyboard is designed with ergonomic split key zones and a gentle slope for the natural positioning of hands, wrists, and forearms, increasing maximum comfort and extended use. With its eye-soothing backlit keys made for increased productivity in dim or dark environments, you can easily switch between green, blue or red lights with one touch of a key! The multi-functional hotkeys allow quick access to your media controls, email, internet browser and other common applications. The Adesso Tru-Form 150 is also designed with membrane key switches that provide a quieter, faster response and stands up to long term usage. Sleek and modern, Adesso Tru-Form 150 brings the best in comfort, efficiency, and style. 

 Specifications: 

 Keyboard Layout: 105-Key US Layout
Connection: USB Cable
Key Type: Membrane
Power Source: PC Powered via USB
LED Indicators: Num Lock, Caps Lock and Scroll Lock
LED Hotkeys: 4 Hotkeys (Brightness Up, Brightness Down, Color Switch, On/Off)
Internet Hotkeys: 7 Hotkeys (Home, Back, Fwd, Refresh, Search, Favorite, Email)
Windows Hotkeys: 9 Hotkeys (Play/Pause, Stop, Previous, Next, Vol. Up, Vol. Down, Mute,Player, My Computer )
Color: Black
Dimensions:20.5” x 9.3” x 1.5” (520 x 235 x 38mm)
Net Weight: 1.95 lbs. (885 g) 

 Requirements: 

 Operating System: Windows 10, 8, 7, Vista, XP
Connectivity Interface: An Available USB Port
feature_bullets: 3 Color (Red, Green, Blue) Illuminated Backlit Keyboard - The 3-color Illuminated Backlit keyboard lets you choose your backlit color to green, blue, or red in one keystroke! The gently-lit keys allow you to work day and night without straining your eyes. No more mistyping! You can work from dusk till dawn at your desk or bedroom without disturbing others!
Ergonomic Design - The design of this keyboard with splitted key zones and gently sloped shape encourages natural position of hands, wrists, and forearm in maximum comfort for long use.
Large Print Keys - Makes the keys easier to see and easy on the eyes.
Split Key Design - Encourages natural position of hands, wrists and forearms for maximum comfort.
Integrated Palm Rest - Keeps your wrists in the most comfortable position.
Internet & Multimedia Keys - You can get instant access to your commonly used Internet and multimedia tools with the 20 built-in hotkeys this keyboard has to offer.
Membrane Switch - 5 Million keystroke lifecycle for a quiet and fast typing experience.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars534 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
